title: Ticket #7073: Automatically set the alias for the collector
description:
When we construct a generic daemon name from a hostname, we set an appropriate hostname alias in the sinful string for use in SSL and GSI peer certificate verification. This allows us to compare the hostname the user provided with the hostname(s) in the certificate. With this information, we no longer need to rely on reverse DNS (which is considered insecure) to go from the IP address in the sinful string to the hostname.

Surprisingly, there are two sets of logic that generate a sinful from a hostname -- one is Daemon::getDaemonInfo and the other is Daemon::findCmDaemon. The alias is not set in the latter, resulting in issues verifying the hostname when someone does 

condor_status -pool foo.example.com

and the collector at foo.example.com itself requires hostname verification.

I'm marking this as a bug in 8.9.2 given that is the first release where SSL host verification is done by default.
